metadata.title: CVE-2020-14342 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - low
metadata.description: It was found that cifs-utils' mount.cifs was invoking a shell whenrequesting the Samba password, which could be used to inject arbitrarycommands. An attacker able to invoke mount.cifs with special permission,such as via sudo rules, could use this flaw to escalate their privileges.

criterions.comment: cifs-utils: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
